Issues.Title: perf(core): only track LViews that are referenced in __ngContext__
Issues.Body: Follow-up to #45051 where every `LView` that was being created was tracked in the `TRACKED_LVIEWS` map. This isn't necessary, because we only need to track the view that have been referenced by an `__ngContext__`.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "perf(core): only track LViews that are referenced in __ngContext__" (#45172)

Issues.Title: Small router refactors
Issues.Body:
1. refactor(router): Update match result to be more explicit

The `lastChild` property in the match result is only used to compute the
remaining segments (i.e. the ones which were not consumed). The updated
type here makes it easier to use and more clear.

2. refactor(router): Refactor errors in applyRedirects to use common throwError function

The implementation of `throwError` in `rxjs` is identical to what is
done manually in the Router code.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Small router refactors" (#45170)

Issues.Title: refactor(forms): Split up `model.ts`.
Issues.Body:
`model.ts` is currently extremely large. This is the first step in an attempt to refactor it to be more easily navigable and reviewable. This commit breaks it up into the following new files:

* `model/form_control.ts`
* `model/form_array.ts`
* `model/form_group.ts`
* `model/abstract_control.ts`
* `model/util.ts`

This first phase is a purely mechanical code move. There is no *new* code, and no interfaces have been separated yet.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "refactor(forms): Split up `model.ts`." (#45197)

Issues.Title: ci: add permissions to current github action workflows
Issues.Body:
The currently recommended best practice for Github action workflows is to set top-level permissions to read only. And if the job uses the automatic `GITHUB_TOKEN`, fine-grained permissions for each job based on the job's requirements should also be added.
All existing workflows in the repository now have top-level read only permission blocks.
Only the `scorecard` workflow currently requires additional job level permissions and the minimum set of permissions were already present for the job.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "ci: add permissions to current github action workflows" (#45177)

Issues.Title: fix(router): Fix type of Route.pathMatch to be more accurate
Issues.Body:
Route.pathMatch only allows `'full'|'prefix'` in reality. This commit
adjusts the type to be more strict and also adds a migration to adjust
existing code.

resolves #37469

BREAKING CHANGE:
The type of `Route.pathMatch` is now more strict. Places that use
`pathMatch` will likely need to be updated to have an explicit
`Route`/`Routes` type so that TypeScript does not infer the type as
`string`.

reviewer notes: migration is in a separate PR (#45084) and has already been run in g3
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(router): Fix type of Route.pathMatch to be more accurate" (#45176)

Issues.Title: @angular/localize loadTranslations can only be default-imported using the 'allowSyntheticDefaultImports' flag.
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are the source of the bug?

localize

### Is this a regression?

Yes

### Description

When an app imports `loadTranslations()` from `@angular/localize` in v13.x.x this throws an error when running `ng build`.

During testing I narrowed this down to `import { loadTranslations } from '@angular/localize';`. This only happens on v13.x.x of @angular packages.

Steps to reproduce:
1. Create a new project using `ng new`
2. Confirm that the project can be build `ng build`
3. Install @angular/localize `npm install @angular/localize`
4. Import `loadTranslations` in `main.ts` (don't have to call it just importing will be enough)
5. Run `ng build` again, the build will error

Adding `allowSyntheticDefaultImports` to tsconfig fixes the error but unsure if this is recommended or not.

_No response_

Issues.Title: fix(localize): avoid imports into `compiler-cli` package
Issues.Body:
The compiler-cli's declaration files are not necessarily compatible with web
environments that use `@angular/localize`, and would inadvertently include
`typescript` declaration files in any compilation unit that uses
`@angular/localize` (which increases parsing time and memory usage during
builds) using a default import that only type-checks when
`allowSyntheticDefaultImports` is enabled.

Fixes #45179
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(localize): avoid imports into `compiler-cli` package" (#45180)

Issues.Title: Angular should report an error when creating a `readonly` input
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are the source of the bug?

compiler

### Is this a regression?

No

### Description

The `@Input` decorator tells Angular that a property can be written to in a template. However, if you add the `@Input` decorator to a `readonly` property, no error is reported. We should report an error, since mixing these two concepts doesn't make sense.
```
@Component(...)
export class UserProfile {
  @Input() readonly name: string;
}
```

At time of writing, there are 37 occurrences of this in Google we'd have to clean up. Not sure if this is prevalent enough to warrant an `ng update` schematic (which would probably just remove `readonly`). 

### Please provide a link to a minimal reproduction of the bug

https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-ivy-j8vlxf?file=src%2Fapp%2Fhello.component.ts

_No response_

Issues.Title: NgModel in input field remains unchanged if model is reset to inital state
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are the source of the bug?

forms

### Is this a regression?

No

### Description

In our app we use a template driven form to collect a connection string for the users preferred database. Since the connection string can contain a password we cut out the password on the server and replace it with *****. So no matter what you enter in the input field, you will always get the same result from the server, but the input field does not reflect those results.

Example:
The input field is initialized with *****, then a user overwrites the password with 'secret password', the server returns ***** but the form field does not reflect this change. Instead it stillt displays 'secret password'.
If the result from the server is different than the initialized state, the input is able to pick up the change.

The form is a template driven form with one way data-binding for [ngModel]. We use one way data-binding here on purpose to achieve unidirectional data flow.

Please also see the simplified example on Stackblitz:
[here](https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-lktucd?file=src/app/app.component.html)

### Please provide a link to a minimal reproduction of the bug

https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-lktucd?file=src/app/app.component.html

_No response_

Issues.Body:

compiler-cli

No

### Description

**Observation 1:** After upgrading an Ivy application to v13, `postinstall: ngcc` wasn't removed automatically during update steps.

**Observation 2:** When a new v13 application is created, `postinstall: ngcc` is not present.

**Query 1:** Is `postinstall: ngcc` required in v13, if the application as well as the library are at the exact same versions of Angular and the corrosponding dependencies and both are Ivy enabled?

**Query 2:** On building an Ivy library, the output `package.json` contains a script that blocks `npm publish`. This has been the behaviour for the past few releases of Angular and now also in v13. Is it due to the on-going development in Ivy area? And do the previous discussed [solution ](https://github.com/angular/angular/issues/41048#issuecomment-791445840)holds true for v13 as well?

Issues.Title: refactor(forms): split apart `model.ts`
Issues.Body:
In the forms package, the main abstractions for controls were previously defined in a file `model.ts`, which contained several thousand lines of code. This made changing the forms abstractions in any way a challenging operation. Additionally, there were several import cycles involving this file and other parts of the forms system.

In this commit, `model.ts` is broken out into a number of files. Several strategies were used to effect this refactoring:

 * The interfaces of the main abstractions are interdependent, and are split out into a separate `model/api.ts` file.
 * Each interface is implemented by a private implementation class.
 * Constructors for each abstraction are defined with a separate constructor signature, and a `const` constructor declaration which is merged with
   the interface type.
 * The `_find` operation, which previously depended on `instanceof` checks with the actual constructor types to achieve different behavior for different types of controls, has been refactored to rely on an internal method on the `AbstractControl` hierarchy instead.

Together, these changes will make the forms package much more maintainable, and pave the way for type-specific changes needed to strongly type the forms abstractions.

Note: this PR was originally drafted by @alxhub, but I am shepherding it through review, since it will prepare typed forms for an easier API review.

Co-authored-by: alxhub
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "refactor(forms): split apart `model.ts`" (#45168)

Issues.Title: URL sanitization breaks URLs containing commas in srcset
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are the source of the bug?

core

### Is this a regression?

No

### Description

Hey,

We're using `[innerHTML]="content"` in angular, where content is HTML from WordPress. WordPress is using cloudinary which generates URLs like 

```
https://res.cloudinary.com/<container>/images/w_844,h_562/f_auto,q_auto/<id>/image.jpg
```

The code that sanitizes `srcset` splits on `,` and joins on `, ` which breaks the URL above.

Code reference: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/master/packages/core/src/sanitization/url_sanitizer.ts#L58

### Please provide a link to a minimal reproduction of the bug

https://codesandbox.io/s/sparkling-resonance-8dyt3u?file=/src/app/app.component.ts

### Please provide the exception or error you saw

```true
If you look at the HTML output, one of the images are broken. The other one works.
```


### Please provide the environment you discovered this bug in (run `ng version`)

```true
Angular CLI: 12.0.4
Node: 16.14.0
Package Manager: npm 6.14.13
OS: darwin arm64

Angular: 12.0.4
... animations, cli, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms
... platform-browser, platform-browser-dynamic, platform-server
... router

Package                         Version
---------------------------------------------------------
@angular-devkit/architect       0.1200.4
@angular-devkit/build-angular   12.0.4
@angular-devkit/core            12.0.4
@angular-devkit/schematics      12.0.4
@angular/cdk                    12.1.0

@nguniversal/express-engine     12.0.2
@schematics/angular             12.0.4
rxjs                            6.6.7
typescript                      4.2.4
```


### Anything else?

A fix could be to join on "," instead. Though it will try to sanitize URLs which aren't URLs.

Issues.Title: refactor(@angular-devkit/build-angular): replace most custom path `resolve` usages with Node.js builtins
Issues.Body: During the build initialization phase, many paths are converted back and forth between multiple normalized forms. These conversions involve potentially expensive string operations. The majority of the custom path `resolve` function from `@angular-devkit/core` usages have now been removed in favor of the Node.js builtin path functions. This change reduces the need to perform additional string manipulation where possible.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "refactor(@angular-devkit/build-angular): replace most custom path `resolve` usages with Node.js builtins" (#22767)

Issues.Title: Webpack's sass-loader `~` deprecation affect
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are the source of the bug?

Don't known / other

### Is this a regression?

No

### Description

Since Webpack has deprecated use of `~` for style imports, this has stopped working in Angular v13 apps as well. 

`@import '~@my-lib/styles/index';`   **<-- Deprecated**

From Webpack's documentation:
> Using ~ is deprecated and can be removed from your code (we recommend it), but we still support it for historical reasons. Why can you remove it? The loader will first try to resolve @import as a relative path. If it cannot be resolved, then the loader will try to resolve @import inside [node_modules](https://webpack.js.org/configuration/resolve/#resolvemodules).

Now, when I try to change the import paths according to the above documentation, then Angular CLI throws an error that it cannot resolve the path i.e. the following doesn't work:

`@import '@my-lib/styles';`   **<-- Doesn't work**

**Query 1:** Why it doesn't work in an Angular app?

But, the following works:

`@import 'node_modules/@my-lib/styles';`   **<-- Works**

**Query 2:** Why does it work with `node_modules/...`?


### Please provide a link to a minimal reproduction of the bug

_No response_

### Please provide the exception or error you saw

_No response_

### Please provide the environment you discovered this bug in (run `ng version`)


Issues.Title: Serving through Express doesn't "live reload" on Angular 13
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

Yes

### Description

We have upgraded from Angular `12` to Angular `13.2.2` and are seeing some unwanted behaviour;

We use an Express server to proxy to our Angular projects, e.g.
* Angular project `a` on port `4300`
* Angular project `b` on port `4400`

Express routes traffic from:
`localhost:9000/a` -> `localhost:4300`
`localhost:9000/b` -> `localhost:4400`

Since the upgrade today, we are not experiencing live reloading of our Angular projects anymore.

Furthermore, when we `ctrl-C` when serving, we get the following error (with `node --trace-warnings`):

```
(node:18181) MaxListenersExceededWarning: Possible EventEmitter memory leak detected. 11 close listeners added to [Server]. Use emitter.setMaxListeners() to increase limit
    at _addListener (events.js:475:17)
    at Server.addListener (events.js:497:10)
    at Server.once (events.js:541:8)
    at Server.close (net.js:1627:12)
    at /Users/rkorebrits/workspace/core/web/upgrade/node_modules/webpack-dev-server/lib/Server.js:3301:25
    at new Promise (<anonymous>)
    at Server.stop (/Users/rkorebrits/workspace/core/web/upgrade/node_modules/webpack-dev-server/lib/Server.js:3299:9)
    at processTicksAndRejections (internal/process/task_queues.js:95:5)
```

Any ideas why this may be happening?

### Please provide a link to a minimal reproduction of the bug

_No response_

### Please provide the exception or error you saw

_No response_

### Please provide the environment you discovered this bug in (run `ng version`)

```true

OS: darwin arm64
```

Issues.Title: @angular-devkit/schematics glossary is missing Task
Issues.Body:
The [Schematics Glossary](https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/tree/master/packages/angular_devkit/schematics#glossary) doesn't introduce what a `Task` is, making it difficult for new schematic developers to know what `Task`s should be used for and how they work.

The _Schematics for libraries_ page on angular.io [demonstrates an example for adding a task](https://angular.io/guide/schematics-for-libraries#providing-installation-support), but it also doesn't provide an explanation on what a `Task` is. When do they run (before/after the `Tree` has been transformed by `Rule`s)? Do they run in parallel? How do you manage `Task` dependencies?

This issue is to document `Task` in the Schematics Glossary table so that it's easier for developers to create their own `Task`s.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "@angular-devkit/schematics glossary is missing Task" (#22764)

Issues.Title: Build-one, deploy-many support around base href
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are relevant/releated to the feature request?

common

### Description

This feature request arises from the StackOverflow question here; https://stackoverflow.com/questions/71225918/how-can-i-set-the-angular-base-path-programmatically-prior-to-initialization/71226764

I have an Angular app that I am attempting to build once and deploy to multiple environments. In my case, an unfortunate client requirement is that each environment is in a folder of a CDN endpoint, e.g. `cdnendpoint.com/dev/[files]`.

This necessitates changing the baseHref for an application, which can be done at build time or as part of modifying the base tag in index.html. It looks like it can be done programmatically as well; however, my attempts to do that fail to load the built angular files themselves, e.g. main.js, because they are still hard-coded to load from the root of the endpoint.

### Proposed solution

In this case, I'm not certain there *is* a solution (but am happy to hear if I've been doing something wrong, and am submitting in case someone sees a solution where I do not). I suppose the built artifacts need to be referenced in some way from index.html and the base tag is the most reasonable way to do that.

It might be that a guide to build once, deploy many angular apps in the docs that covers things like externalizing config and things like this that might have to be done could be helpful.

### Alternatives considered

The StackOverflow in the description walks through the alternatives I've tried in detail.

Thank you for considering!
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Build-one, deploy-many support around base href" (#22758)

Issues.Title: fix(@angular-devkit/build-angular): find `ngswConfig` as relative to the application root
Issues.Body:
Previously when determining the `configPath` for building the service worker, the config path
was loaded as a relative path to location where  execution of ng build occured.  Instead the
`ngswConfig` value provided in `angular.json` should be considered relative to th application
root, as is the case with the other paths provided in the configuration.

Before this change, assuming a project root of `/project`, and a `ngswConfig` value of `ngsw-config.json`,
the application built successfully when the exuction working directory was `/project`, but if the
user invoked ng build from `/project/src` for instance, the build failed as `ngsw-config.json` does not
exist at `/project/src/ngsw-config.json`.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(@angular-devkit/build-angular): find `ngswConfig` as relative to the application root" (#22749)

Issues.Title: fix(material/sort): remove role from header when disabled
Issues.Body:
When the sort header is disabled, we make it non-interactive by clearing its `tabindex`, however it still has the `role="button"` which can throw off screen readers if it doesn't have text.

These changes also clear the `role` from the header if it's disabled.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(material/sort): remove role from header when disabled" (#24477)

Issues.Title: bug(map-marker-clusterer): do not work without markerclustererplus
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

it doesn't works without importing `<script src="https://unpkg.com/@googlemaps/markerclustererplus/dist/index.min.js"></script>`, which is the old library

## Code Example
```html
<google-map #googleMap width="100%" height="100%" (idle)="initClusterer($event)">
  <map-marker-clusterer *ngIf="googleMap?.googleMap">
    <ng-container *ngFor="let i of items">
      <ng-container *ngIf="i.categories | haveCategory: targetCategory">
        <map-marker #markerElem [position]="i.position"> </map-marker>
      </ng-container>
    </ng-container>
  </map-marker-clusterer>
</google-map>
```

```typescript
@ViewChild('googleMap', { static: true }) googleMap: GoogleMap
markerCluster?: MarkerClusterer

initClusterer(e) {
    console.log('initClusterer', e)
    if (!this.googleMap?.googleMap || this.markerCluster) return

    console.log(this.googleMap, this.googleMap.googleMap)
    this.markerCluster = new MarkerClusterer({
      map: this.googleMap.googleMap,
      markers: this.markerElem,
    })
}
```

### Reproduction

Steps to reproduce:
1. Download `npm i @googlemaps/markerclusterer`
2. Download `npm i @types/google.maps --save-dev`
3. Create a component and use it as bellow
4. Add the `GoogleMapsModule` in the import

### Expected Behavior

Work as normal

### Actual Behavior

Do not load and get the following
```
vendor.js:91237 ERROR Error: MarkerClusterer class not found, cannot construct a marker cluster. Please install the MarkerClustererPlus library: https://github.com/googlemaps/js-markerclustererplus
    at MapMarkerClusterer.ngOnInit (vendor.js:125746:15)
```

### Environment

- Angular: 13.2.3
- CDK/Material: 13.2.3
- Browser(s): Chrome
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Windows 11
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(map-marker-clusterer): do not work without markerclustererplus " (#24478)

Issues.Title: feat(menu): Add delay before closing nested menu after mouse leave
Issues.Body:
### Feature Description

**Problem**

When navigating through nested menu items, we must follow a tight path, otherwise it'll close the nested menu.

**Proposed Solution**

In the current behavior, after the mouse leave, the menu is closed. 
If we add some delay, before closing the nested menu after the mouse leave event, we could leverage from better navigation.

**Sugestion**

Add an option (matMenuNestedCloseDelay) to change the behavior of closing the nested menu. 
When this option is used, it should wait X miliseconds (similar to matTooltipShowDelay) before closing the nested menu after mouse leave. 

Also add this option to [MatMenuDefaultOptions](https://material.angular.io/components/menu/api#MatMenuDefaultOptions) to allow override this behavior with injection token.

```
<mat-menu #menu="matMenu" matMenuNestedCloseDelay="300">
     ...
</mat-menu>
```




### Use Case

If I try to selected the 90 days options, througth the smallest path, it closes the nested menu.

![Animation](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12090931/155517615-63074bfb-b909-4a7a-afe8-7a15dfa57a05.gif)

**Desired Behavior**

Taken from [stackoverflow](https://stackoverflow.com/a/50953452) with similar issue.
![Animation2](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12090931/155519988-513f1cd9-803d-493f-993b-b10b1af9b93c.gif)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "feat(menu): Add delay before closing nested menu after mouse leave" (#24476)

Issues.Title: fix(material/tooltip): don't hide when pointer moves to tooltip
Issues.Body:
Currently we hide the tooltip as soon as the pointer leaves the trigger element which may be problematic with larger cursors that partially obstruct the content.

These changes allow hover events on the tooltip and add extra logic so that moving to it doesn't start the hiding sequence.

Fixes #4942.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(material/tooltip): don't hide when pointer moves to tooltip" (#24475)

Issues.Title: feat(material/icon): Ability to update icon's SVG when you register it using `MatIconRegistry`
Issues.Body:
### Description

When we use a `mat-icon` with a SVG registered through `MatIconRegistry`, `mat-icon` shows the SVG but **won't update** itself if we change it later, meaning we add a new SVG with the same name.

I believe the problem goes back to this line. https://github.com/angular/components/blob/6d8693d0b66e2835795858544a5dce594e76fb6f/src/material/icon/icon.ts#L441


Which seems logical to avoid performance issues. Probably we need to provide a way to reload the icons if we ever wanted to. I did this hack and it's working. Check out the second icon in the[ example stackblitz](https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-hbo85y?file=src/app/icon-svg-example.ts).

```TypeScript
  @ViewChild(MatIcon) icon: MatIcon;
  ...
  
  iconRegistry.addSvgIconLiteral(
    'icon-name',
    sanitizer.bypassSecurityTrustHtml(NEW_SVG)
  );
  
   // @ts-ignore
  this.icon._updateSvgIcon(this.icon._svgIcon);

```

I would suggest adding a method to `MatIcon` component:

```TypeScript
  reloadSvgIcon(): void{
      this._updateSvgIcon(this._svgIcon);
  }    
```


### Reproduction

Register the icon after it has been rendered. You can check out an example here on [this stackblitz](https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-hbo85y?file=src/app/icon-svg-example.ts)

### Expected Behavior

When doing `iconRegistry.addSvgIconLiteral('svg-icon', ...);`  it is expcted to see the already rendered `mat-icon` with `svgIcon="svg-icon"` to get updated and show the newly added SVG in `iconRegistry`.

### Actual Behavior

`mat-icon` component won't show the new SVG.

### Environment

- Angular: 13.1.1
- CDK/Material: 13.1.1
- Browser(s): Chrome 98
- Operating System : Ubuntu
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "feat(material/icon): Ability to update icon's SVG when you register it using `MatIconRegistry`" (#24471)

Issues.Title: bug(cdkDragDrop/mat-dialog): cdkDragDrop does not work when page is scrolled before opening dialog
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

I have a cdkDragList inside an mat-dialog-overlay. When the page is scrolled before opening the dialog, then the drag drop behaviour is not working correctly.
Instead of directly reordering the list on drag, the item has to be dragged at least the distance, which the page previously was scrolled. Which makes it also impossible to reorder the list, once you have scrolled far enough.

### Reproduction

Here is a simple StackBlitz example: https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-ivy-7bnaz4

Steps to reproduce:
1. Click the first button to see the expected behaviour.
2. Scroll down to second button
3. Click the second button
4. Try reordering the list


### Expected Behavior

I expect both cases to behave the same.

### Actual Behavior

When using the second button, after scrolling, then the items won't reorder unless dragged far more than needed.

### Environment

Output of `ng version` from my project.
```
$ ng version

     _                      _                 ____ _     ___
    / \   _ __   __ _ _   _| | __ _ _ __     / ___| |   |_ _|
   / â–³ \ | '_ \ / _` | | | | |/ _` | '__|   | |   | |    | |
  / ___ \| | | | (_| | |_| | | (_| | |      | |___| |___ | |
 /_/   \_\_| |_|\__, |\__,_|_|\__,_|_|       \____|_____|___|
                |___/
    

Angular CLI: 11.2.11
Node: 14.18.1
OS: linux x64

Angular: 11.2.12
... animations, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms
... platform-browser, platform-browser-dynamic, router
Ivy Workspace: Yes

Package                         Version
---------------------------------------------------------
@angular-devkit/architect       0.1102.11
@angular-devkit/build-angular   0.1102.11
@angular-devkit/core            11.2.11
@angular-devkit/schematics      11.2.11
@angular/cdk                    11.2.11
@angular/cli                    11.2.11
@angular/material               11.2.11
@schematics/angular             11.2.11
@schematics/update              0.1102.11
rxjs                            6.6.7
typescript                      4.1.5
```

My project is running on Angular 11, but the StackBlitz provided is using Angular 13, to ensure the bug still exists and is not fixed already.
Tested OS'es are Ubuntu 21.10 and MacOS 12.
Browsers tested are: 
- Microsoft Edge 98
- Firefox 97
- Safari 15
- Chromium 95
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "bug(cdkDragDrop/mat-dialog): cdkDragDrop does not work when page is scrolled before opening dialog" (#24467)

Issues.Title: bug(material/input): name property setting overrides developer defined name property
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [X] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

v13.1.2

### Description

This [change](https://github.com/angular/components/commit/feac08f13843e3476245535a7fa5f3dfee04b027) broke a lot of code. The issue is tons of code was adapted to the fact that Angular Material input was not setting name attribute, so they directly set it themselves. Now with this change Angular Material Input overrides that.

For example, see [Covalent Dynamic Forms Input](https://github.com/Teradata/covalent/blob/main/src/platform/dynamic-forms/dynamic-elements/dynamic-input/dynamic-input.component.html)

### Reproduction

Steps to reproduce:
1. Set name attribute on a mat-input field directly with `[attr.name]="name"`
2. Try to access element by name attribute, such as in tests.


### Expected Behavior

If name attribute is directly set, then Angular Material Input needs to set name attribute more carefully.

### Actual Behavior

Angular Material Input overrides name attribute directly set by user of mat-input.

### Environment

- Angular: 13.2.2
- CDK/Material: 13.2.2
- Browser(s): Any
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Any
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(material/input): name property setting overrides developer defined name property" (#24463)

Issues.Body:
It seems that it was accidentally added in the first version of the component. unneeded attribute `xml:space` is removed.

Info about `xml:space`: http://www.xmlplease.com/xml/xmlspace/

Issues.Title: fix(material-experimental/mdc-dialog): align change detection with non-MDC version
Issues.Body: The non-MDC dialog container uses `Default` change detection while the MDC one uses `OnPush` which causes issues for users trying to migrate. These changes align the behavior to make things easier.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(material-experimental/mdc-dialog): align change detection with non-MDC version" (#24451)

Issues.Title: feat(material/menu): support zone-less mode
Issues.Body:
The template:

```html
<button mat-button [matMenuTriggerFor]="menu">Menu</button>
<mat-menu #menu="matMenu">
  <button mat-menu-item>Item 1</button>
  <button mat-menu-item>Item 2</button>
</mat-menu>
```

Basically, the `mat-menu` is never opened when the zone is nooped through `{ ngZone: 'noop' }`. I've left comments near my changes. The CI will prolly fail so I'll fix it after it's run.

### Before
https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7337691/154817177-e83822d7-6fb1-487c-b101-57385deed9bb.mp4

### After
https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7337691/154817212-5cc30100-5c74-4b19-9c49-66910238633c.mp4
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "feat(material/menu): support zone-less mode" (#24452)
